fields.Title: Essentially non-oscillatory stencil selection and subcell resolution in uncertainty quantification.
fields.Publisher: Lect. Notes Comput. Sci. Eng., Springer, Heidelberg
fields.Description/Abstract:
This paper concerns stochastic computational problems and in particular addresses the reliable approximation of discontinuities and the associated uncertainty quantification. The authors extend the essentially non-oscillatory (ENO) type stencil selection and subcell resolution robustness principles from finite volume methods for computational fluid dynamics and apply them in conjunction with the simplex stochastic collocation uncertainty quantification method to achieve a sharp refinement of discontinuities in probability space and a genuinely discontinuous representation of random spacial discontinuities. The authors demonstrate the effectiveness of their approach on various physical problems, including a linear advection problem, a shock tube Riemann problem and the transonic flow over an airfoil.
